work.name: Diderot
work.summary: Course management system used by Carnegie Mellon and other universities. Features a custom LaTeX-based UI, assignment submissions, code autograding, comment/posts system.
highlights: Built and tested AI microservice built on OpenAI's GPT-4.0. Deployed using FastAPI, Docker, AWS ECR.
Wrote script to anonymize sensitive user information using regular expressions. Implemented basic autocorrect usin Levenshtein distance.
Built pipelines for extracting, cleaning, and formatting data from PostgreSQL database to be used for fine-tuning OpenAI's GPT-3.0 model.

work.name: Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science
highlights: Working on job scheduler that amortizes carbon cost of manufacturing server-grade CPUs by extending their hardware lifecycle in datacenters.
Using DeathStarBench's service suite to compare tail latency of microservices across different hardware.
Wrote scripts using Python, Docker CLI to automate setup and scaling of microservices on CPU nodes.

education.area: Electrical & Computer Engineering, Minor in Computer Science
courses: 15-210: Parallel & Sequential Data Structures and Algorithms
15-251: Great Ideas in Theoretical Computer Science
18-240: Structure and Design of Digital Systems
